artist: Artist: Francisco José de Goya y Lucientes
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: image of a figure bound in chains, bent over with hands clasped together; ankles bound in heavy shackles; head with shaggy beard and hair turned to the L
inscription:
Inscription

-- publication details inscribed in plate below image: [Gazette des Beaux-Arts | Imp. Delátre, Paris.]
-- in graphite at bottom of sheet: [5 x 5 3/4 - 3 1/2 - | 203 / 5434 | R (circled) 
-- in graphite on recto: SPG 7743
provenance: [C. & J. Goodfriend, New York; sold February 13, 1986, to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Tan bárbara la seguridad como el delito
